geneSummary: KIT, a receptor tyrosine kinase, is recurrently mutated in gastrointestinal stromal tumors.

mutationEffect.description: The KIT R888Q mutation is located in the kinase domain of the protein. This mutation has been identified in biliary tract adenocarcinoma and is a statistically significant hotspot (PMID: 29360550). In vitro studies with melanoma cell lines expressing KIT R888Q demonstrate that the mutation is inactivating as measured by decreased SCF-induced activation compared to wildtype (PMID: 23020152).

variantSummary: The KIT R888Q mutation is likely neutral.
